intro: Aconogonon rumicifolium, commonly known as the redroot false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive red or purple coloration on the underside, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The plant is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine, though its medicinal properties remain under study.
